task.title: Landing Checklist
task.shortdesc: On any landing, enter traffic as instructed by field regulations or as instructed by the control tower.

context.p: Adjust the power settings to bring the speed below 170 mph but not below 150 mph. Prior to landing, make this landing check:
context.note: Do not allow the speed to drop below 150 mph until you are on the approach.

step.cmd: Carburetor heat "NORMAL" except in severe icing conditions.
Propellers 2400 rpm— This permits the use of maximum climbing power in the event of a go-around. (See power control charts.)
Landing gear "DOWN"—locked and safetied, visually and orally checked.
step.info: You can check the main gear visually and the nose gear on the selsyn indicator, and, if the prop hub is polished, you can check it by its reflection in the hub. There is a warning horn in some aircraft and a warning light in later models. This warning system operates when the throttles are retarded.

cmd.option: Optional with local regulations, you may use 15Â° of flaps on the downwind leg to improve visibility and to improve handling characteristics at low speeds.
